sentences.sentence: The Miser( 守财奴 )
A miser( 守财奴 ) had some gold which he buried( 埋 ) in the ground.
He came to check it every day.
One day, he found that it was stolen, and he began to pull out his hair and cry loudly.
A neighbor, seeing him, said,
“Don’t cry, bury( 埋 ) a stone in the hole, and pretend( 假装 ) it is the gold.
It will be just as good, since when the gold was there, you made no use of it.”
MORAL: The value of money depends not on( 并非取决于... ) how much you have, but how you use it.
The Monkey and the Camel( 骆驼 )
The animals of the forest put on( 举办 ) a show.
At the show, a monkey stood up and danced.
He impressed( 使印象深刻 ) the crowd( 观众 ) so much that he was cheered by all.
A camel( 骆驼 ) that was envious( 嫉妒的 ) of the monkey, and eager( 渴望的 ) to get the attention of the guests,
said he would stand up and dance for them.
He danced so badly that the animals, in anger, beat him out of the party.
MORAL: It is foolish( 愚蠢的 ) to imitate( 模仿 ) those who are better than us.
The Mountain Giving Birth
A mountain started to move.
Loud noises were heard, and crowds of( 成群的 ) people came from all around to see what the matter was.
While they were waiting for something terrible to happen, out came a mouse.
MORAL: Don’t make a big fuss( 大惊小怪 ) about nothing.
The Noisy Wheels
As some oxen( 公牛 ) were pulling a wagon( 四轮运货车 ) along a bumpy( 高低不平的 ) road, the wheels began to make a lot of noise.
The driver said to the wagon( 四轮运货车 ), “Why do you make so much noise when the animals who are doing all the work are silent?”
MORAL: Those who cry the loudest are not always the ones who are hurt the most.
The Nurse and the Wolf( 狼 )
“Be quiet now,” said an old nurse to a crying child sitting on her lap( 大腿部 ).
“If you make that noise again, I will throw you to the wolf( 狼 ).”
It happened that a wolf( 狼 ) was passing close under the window as this was said.
So, he sat down by the side of the house and waited.
“I am in good luck today,” he thought.
“It is sure to cry soon, and I haven’t eaten such good food for many days.”
He waited, and he waited, and he waited, until at last the child began to cry.
The wolf( 狼 ) then moved towards the window, and looked up to the nurse, shaking his tail.
But the nurse only shut the window and called for help( 呼救 ),
and the dogs of the house came rushing out and chased( 追捕 ) the wolf( 狼 ) away.
MORAL: Don’t rely on( 相信 ) your enemies to keep their promises.
The Oak Tree( 橡树 ) and the Reeds( 芦苇 )
A very large oak tree( 橡树 ) was blown down by the wind, and fell into some reeds( 芦苇 ).
It said to them, “I wonder how you, who are so light and weak, are not blown away by these strong winds.”
They replied, “You fight against the wind, and so you are destroyed( 被毁灭 ).
We, however, bend( 弯曲 ) easily, and therefore don’t get broken.”
MORAL: Be flexible( 灵活的 ) to survive( 存活 ).
The Oaks( 橡树 ) and Zeus
The oak trees( 橡树 ) presented a complaint( 抱怨 ) to Zeus, saying,
“We no longer wish to live, since we are in constant( 不断的 ) danger of being cut down by men.”
Zeus replied, “You have only yourselves to blame( 责怪 ) for your danger.
If you did not make such excellent pillars( 柱子 ) and posts,
and prove( 证明 ) yourselves so useful to the carpenters( 木匠 ) and the farmers,
the ax would not so often be used on your roots( 根部 ).”
MORAL: Be careful not to be too useful to the wrong people.

question.cn: 在the Miser故事中，那个守财奴丢了什么东西？
question.en: In the story the Miser, what did the miser lose?

analysis: 文中提到：“A miser had some gold which he buried in the ground. . . he found that it was stolen.”由此可知那个守财奴丢失的是一些金子，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Monkey and the Camel中，为什么骆驼要为观众跳舞？
question.en: In the story the Monkey and the Camel, why did the camel want to dance for the animals?

options.cn: 猴子鼓励骆驼上台跳舞。
options.en: The monkey encouraged him to dance on the stage.

options.cn: 骆驼想得到观众们的注意力。
options.en: The camel wanted to get the attention of other animals.

analysis: 文中提到：“A camel was envious of the monkey, and eager to get the attention of the guests.”所以骆驼跳舞的目的是想得到观众们的注意力，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Nurse and the Wolf 中，狼等在房子旁边的目的是什么？
question.en: In the story the Nurse and the Wolf, why did the wolf wait beside the house?

options.en: He wanted to eat the crying child.
He wanted to get some help from the nurse.

analysis: 文中提到狼听到护士的话后，认为自己很幸运。“It is sure to cry soon and I haven't eaten such good food for many days.”可见，狼等在房子外的目的是吃小孩，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Oak Tree and the Reeds中，为什么芦苇没被风吹倒？
question.en: In the story the Oak Tree and the Reeds, why were the reeds not blown down by the wind?

options.en: Because they fought against the wind.

analysis: 文中提到：“We, however, bend easily, and therefore don't get broken.”最后总结“Be flexible to survive.”可知芦苇没被风吹倒是因为很灵活，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Oaks and Zeus中，为什么人类经常砍伐橡树？
question.en: In the story the Oaks and Zeus, why did men often cut down oak trees?

options.en: The oak trees were useful to men.
The oak trees were harmful to human’s crops.
The oak trees were too old.

analysis: 文中提到：“If you did not make such excellent pillars and posts, and prove yourselves so useful to the carpenters and the farmers, the ax would not so often be used on your roots.”可知，人类经常砍伐橡树是因为橡树对人类有很大的用处，因此选A。
